questions.question_text:
You have created payment terms in a system and associated them in the USA reference data set. All the payment terms in the system are shown as follows.
Business Unit X has a set assignment of Enterprise Set for payment terms.
Payment Term = Net 30; Reference Data Set = Enterprise Set
Payment Term = Net 45; Reference Data Set = Enterprise Set
Payment Term = 1%/10 Net 30; Reference Data Set = USA Set
Payment Term = Net 45; Reference Data Set = USA Set
If an invoice is created in Business Unit X, which payment term set is available for use in a transaction?

discussion.content:
LATEST RELEASE 20b:
Receivables - Payment Terms - Assignment to one set only, with common values

Reference Data Sharing Methods
Variations exist in the methods used to share data in reference data sets across different types of objects. Methods relevant to AR:

Assignment to one set only, with common values:
This method is the most commonly used method of sharing reference data that allows defining reference data object instance across all sets. e.g., Receivables Transaction Types are assigned to a common set that's available to all the business units. You need not explicitly assign the transaction types to each business unit. In addition, you can assign a business unit-specific set of transaction types. At transaction entry, the list of values for transaction types includes the following:
-Transaction types from the set assigned to the business unit.
-Transaction types assigned to the common set that's shared across all business units.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/applications-common/20b/faesc/reference-data.html#FAESC135275

questions.question_text:
A customer calls the Accounts Receivables department and asks for the balance of all invoices that are due in the next 30 days. The customer also has a question about a specific invoice line.
As a Billing Specialist, which action would you take?

discussion.content: A is the correct answer: Review Customer Account Details where you can filter by total open receivables and drill down on a specific invoice record

D. may be more correct.

Manage Transaction Information; Review of Transactions and Transaction Activities
Use the Manage Transactions page to view detailed or summary information about your invoices, credit memos, debit memos, and chargebacks. Along with standard search and display functions, you can perform these activities on selected transactions:
Review Installments
View Balance Details
View Transaction Activities

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/financials/20b/faofc/manage-customer-billing.html#FAOFC1479574

choices.D: Search for open invoices on the Manage Transaction search page.
choices.A: Search for the information in the Review Customer Account Details user interface.
choices.B: Apply, reverse, or process the receipt.

The Collections Administrator creates a bankruptcy request in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) application and a collector should have the Collection Manager and Customer Profile Administrator roles assigned.
choices.A: Preferences must be enabled and Enable Bankruptcy must be set to Yes for the customer.
choices.C: Preferences must be enabled and Enable Bankruptcy must be set to Yes in Manage Collections Preferences in the Functional Setup Manager for Advanced Collections.
choices.D: The Collections Manager creates a bankruptcy request in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) application and a collector should be configured as a resource.
choices.E: Bankruptcy must be applied at the customer level, which includes all transactions at the customer, account, and Site levels.
choices.F: The customer does not have the default strategy and default collector assigned at the customer account and site level.

discussion.content: C and E options are correct

C & E are clearly the correct answers.

questions.question_text:
You are not able to initiate a bankruptcy request at the customer site level on behalf of a customer.
Which two conditions are failing? (Choose two.)
Where is the summary delinquency data displayed on the Collections Dashboard?
In which two ways would you configure Satisfaction Method (SM) and Satisfaction Measurement Model (SMM) in Revenue Management to recognize revenue for performance obligations over time? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Allow Partial allows to recognize revenue when at least one of the promises in the performance obligation is fulfilled. Hence B& C

choices.C: by setting SM to "Allow Partial" and SMM to "Period"
choices.D: by setting SM to "Requires Complete" and SMM to "Quantity"
choices.B: by setting SM to "Allow Partial" and SMM to "Percent"
choices.A: by setting SM to "Requires Complete" and SMM to "Period"
choices.E: by setting SM to "Requires Complete" and SMM to "Percent"
